pages.text: The following content is only available if Firmalife is installed. $(thing)Chocolate$() does not need to come only in boring bars! Melt down $(thing)White$(), $(thing)Milk$(), or $(thing)Dark$() chocolate in a $(thing)Vessel$() or $(thing)Crucible$() and then cast it into a mold to obtain chocolate confections. There are three types of chocolate confections: $(thing)Hearts$(), $(thing)Bells$(), and $(thing)Knives$(). Each is obtained by casting chocolate into a different mold.
Knapping a $(thing)Heart Mold$(), used to create $(thing)Heart$()-shaped chocolates.

Chocolate confections provide the same nutrition as chocolate bars, but they are faster to eat. However, if these confections are prepared at specific times of the year, they will gain a trait that doubles their nutrition. $(thing)Chocolate Hearts$() gain the $(thing)Romantic$() trait in Februrary, $(thing)Chocolate Christmas Bells$() gain the $(thing)Festive$() trait in December, and $(thing)Chocolate Candy Knives$() gain the $(thing)Scary$() trait in October.

Moreover, confections can be $(thing)filled$() to gain additional benefits. Confections filled with $(thing)Jam$() have extra $(thing)Fruit$() nutrition. Confections filled with $(thing)Alcohol$() give positive potion effects.
Eating chocolates filled with $(thing)Sweet Liquor$() gives a speed buff.
Eating chocolates filled with $(thing)Strong Liquor$() gives damange resistance.
Eating chocolates filled with $(thing)Whiskey$() gives haste.
